TopicTitle: what youd like to see in KSP

Articles.Content: i know this has probably been asked already many times. but what would you like to see in ksp? id like to see if possible weather effects. like thunderstorms and rain and stuff. or at least some form of wind that would effect the way the rocket/planes fly in the atmosphere. it would be cool to launch a rocket in the middle of a thunderstorm and like have it get hit by lightning that would like maybe knock out your SAS for a while or something like that. just a thought, wondering what everyone else would like to see.

From http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/50346-What-are-you-missing-in-KSP

My short list of immediate wants:

  • Life support that actually matters, rather than just a few extra parts that cause some inconvenience. Crew mental and physical health, supplies, etc...
  • Actually difficult reentry and aerobraking requiring heat shields. Ties in with improved aerodynamics.
  • Random part damage. Should be a pretty rare occurrence and should be fixable given the right conditions, but it'd be nice to have failures that weren't always your fault.
  • Time delay for probes and a way to give them commands.
  • Science (on the way).

More science equipment is something I despritly want. Like Gigercounters, spectrometers, magnisphereic eqipement, and etc.

More planets and asteroids.
Honestly... There are so many of these threads its pathetic... We need to have a sticky megathread in my opinion.

Just something to do on the planets when you get there.

Mining, science, interplanetary volleyball league....just some kind of purpose for going.

Also depleting life support resources, along with a means of resupplying them off Kerbin. For long term missions an onboard garden to use for food and oxygen farming, doesn't need to be overly complex, just a pain in the ass to have to cart around.
